publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1331 Ms Margo MacDonald: Library of Alexandria-That the Parliament congratulates the government and the people of Egypt on the completion of the new Library of Alexandria and, noting the rich history of Scotland's own literature, asks that an appropriate collection of works is gifted to the people of Egypt in recognition of their achievement.

S1M-1331 Ms Margo MacDonald: Library of Alexandria-That the Parliament congratulates the government and the people of Egypt on the completion of the new Library of Alexandria and, noting the rich history of Scotland's own literature, asks that an appropriate collection of works is gifted to the people of Egypt in recognition of their achievement.
S1M-1331 Library of Alexandria (lodged on 9 November 2000) Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1331 Library of Alexandria (lodged on 9 November 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Alex Neil*, Mr Keith Harding*
S1M-1331 Library of Alexandria (lodged on 9 November 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Donald Gorrie*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1331 Library of Alexandria (lodged on 9 November 2000) Michael Russell*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-1331 Ms Margo MacDonald: Library of Alexandria-That the Parliament congratulates the government and the people of Egypt on the completion of the new Library of Alexandria and, noting the rich history of Scotland's own literature, asks that an appropriate collection of works is gifted to the people of Egypt in recognition of their achievement. Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Andrew Wilson, Mr Brian Monteith, Alex Neil, Mr Keith Harding, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Tricia Marwick, Michael Russell, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Adam Ingram
S1M-1331 Library of Alexandria (lodged on 9 November 2000) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1331 Library of Alexandria (lodged on 9 November 2000) Scott Barrie*

S1M-1331 Ms Margo MacDonald: Library of Alexandria—That the Parliament congratulates the government and the people of Egypt on the completion of the new Library of Alexandria and, noting the rich history of Scotland’s own literature, asks that an appropriate collection of works is gifted to the people of Egypt in recognition of their achievement. S1M-1331 Library of Alexandria (lodged on 9 November 2000) Ms Sandra White*
